gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਅੱਤ੍ਰਘਾਤੰ ਗਿਰੇ ਚੳੁਰ ਚੀਰੰ || ਰੁਲੇ ਤੱਛ ਮੁੱਛੰ ੳੁਠੇ ਤਿੱਛ ਤੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bhae Attraghaatan Gire Chaur Chderan|| Rule Tachchh Mouchchhan Outhe Tichchh Tderan||
translation: With the blwos of arms, the fly-whisks and the garments behan to fall and with the volley of arrows, the chopped bodies began to fall on the ground.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਸੁੰਡੰ ਸੁੰਡੰ ਰਣੰ ਭੀਮ ਰੂਪੰ || ਮਨੋ ਖੇਲ ਪੳੁਢੇ ਹਠੀ ਫਾਗ ਜੂਪੰ ||੪੩||
transliteration: Gire Sound Mounndan Ranan Bheem Roopan|| Mano Khel Paudhe Hathiphaag Joopan||43||
translation: The chopped trunks and heads of huge elephants began to fall; it appeared that the group of persistent youths was playing Holi.43.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੇ ਖੱਗਯੰ ਖੇਤ ਖਿੰਗੰ ਸੁ ਧੀਰੰ || ਸੁਭੈ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਜਾਨ ਸੋ ਸੂਰਬੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bade Khaggyan Khet Khingadg Su Dhderan|| Soubhai Sastra Sanjaan So Soorbderan||
translation: The sword and daggers of the warriors with the power of endurance have been struck and the brave fighters are bedecked with weapons and armours.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਗੳੁਰ ਗਾਜੀ ਖੁਲੇ ਹੱਥਿ ਬੱਥੰ || ਨਚਿਯੋ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਰੁਦ੍ਰੰ ਨਚੇ ਮੰਛ ਮੱਖੰ ||੪੪||
transliteration: Gire Gaddd Gadjikhule Hatth(i) Batthan|| Nachiyo Rudra Rudran Nache Machchh Matthan||44||
translation: The mighty heroes have fallen down with empty hands and seeing all this spectacle, the god Shiva is busy in another dance and on the other side, the Machh incarnation, being pleased, is stirring the ocean.44.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਬੀਰ ਗੱਜੇ || ਸੁਭੰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੱਜੇ || ਬਧੇ ਗੱਜ ਗਾਹੰ || ਸੁ ਹੂਰੰ ੳੁਛਾਹੰ ||੪੫||
transliteration: Mahaa Beer Gadje|| Soubhan Sastra Sajje|| Badhe Gadj Gadhan|| Su Hooran Ouchhaadan||45||
translation: Bedecked with auspicious weapons, the brave fighters are thundering and seeing the killing of huge and mighty warriors like elephants, the heavenly damsels, being passed with their feats, are waiting in heaven, in order to wed them.45.

gurmukhi: ਢਲਾ ਢੁਕ ਢਾਲੰ || ਝਮੀ ਤੇਗ ਕਾਲੰ || ਕਟਾ ਕਾਟ ਬਾਹੈਂ || ੳੁਭੈ ਜੀਤ ਚਾਹੈਂ ||੪੬||
transliteration: Dhalaa Dhouk Dhaalan|| Jhamiteg Kaalan|| Kat Baahain Oubhai Jeet Chaahain|| Jhameen||46||
translation: The noises of the knocking on the shields and the blows of the swords are being heard, the daggers are being struck with clattering sound, and both the side are desirous of their victory.46.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਖੰ ਮੁੱਛ ਬੰਕੀ || ਤਮੰ ਤੇਗ ਅਤੰਕੀ || ਫਿਰੈਂ ਗੳੁਰ ਗਾਜੀ || ਨਚੈਂ ਤੁੰਦ ਤਾਜੀ ||੪੭||
transliteration: Moukhanndmouchchh Bankee|| Tamannd Teg Atankee|| Phirain Gaddd Gadjee|| Nachain Tound Taajee|| Phirain Gaddd Gadjee|| Nachain Tound Taajee||47||
translation: The whickers on the faces and terrible swords in the hands of the warriors look impressive, the mighty warriors are wandering in the battlefield and supremely swift horses are dancing.47.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਯੋ ਰੋਸ ਸੰਖਾਸੁਰੰ ਦੇਖ ਸੈਣੰ || ਤਪੇ ਬੀਰ ਬਕਤ੍ਰੰ ਕੀੲੇ ਰਕਤ ਨੈਣੰ ||
transliteration: Bdaryo Ros Sankhaasuran Dekh Sainan|| Tape Beer Baktran Keee Rakat Nainan||
translation: On seeing the army, Shankhasura was highly enraged, other heroes also blazing with anger began to shout loudly, with their eyes reddened with blood.

gurmukhi: ਭੁਜਾ ਠੋਕ ਭੂਪੰ ਕਰਯੋ ਨਾਦ ੳੁੱਚੰ || ਸੁਣੇ ਗਰਭਣੀਅਾਨ ਕੇ ਗਰਭ ਮੁੱਚੰ ||੪੮||
transliteration: Bhujaa Thok Bhoopan Daryo Naad Ouchchannd|| Soune Gadbhaneeaan Ke Gadbh Mouchchannd||48||
translation: The king Shankhasura, knocking his arms, raised a terrible thunder and hearing his frightening sound, the pregnancy of women was miscarried.48.
